WORK SETTING: Most computer and information research scientists work full time.

Work in computer systems design and related services, in manufacturing, or for software publishers. They often work in offices and on teams with other software developers or quality assurance analysts and testers.
Management analysts may travel frequently to meet with clients. Some work more than 40 hours per week.
Physicists and astronomers may work in offices, research laboratories, and observatories. Most physicists and astronomers work full time, and some work more than 40 hours per week.
Biochemists and biophysicists typically work in laboratories and offices to conduct experiments and analyze the results. Most work full time.

Plumbers, pipefitters, and steamfitters work in factories, homes, businesses, and other places where there are pipes and related systems. Plumbers are often on call for emergencies, so evening and weekend work is common.
Bars, Restaurants hotels, work late nights and under pressure
